sen.j: 作品は典型的な複式夢幻能の形式をとり、旅の僧が漁師にであう前段、漁師がきえた後、僧がその不思議を土地の住人にたずねる狂言部分、主人公義経が生前の姿であらわれる後段の三部構成をとる。
sen.e: The work is written in the classic form of Fukushiki Mugen-Noh, which consists of three parts: a first part in which travelling monks happen to see fishermen, the Kyogen part (a farce played during a Noh play cycle), in which the fishermen have disappeared and the monks ask a local villager about this mystery, and a last part in which the main character Yoshitsune appears as a ghost.

sen.e: The enemies that I thought were seagulls and the battle cries that I thought was the wind blowing through the bay of Takamatsu.'

sen.e: The wind blows harshly and everything returns to the morning storm.'
sen.cmt: 上記に続く文章を「。」ごとに分割、あとでまとめて記されていた現代語訳をそれぞれの文の直後に付け、「」をつけました。
sen.e: The wind blows harshly and everything returns to the morning storm.'
The wind blew so harshly through Takamatsu Bay that it became a morning storm.'

sen.j: この謡曲と共に、都の僧の夢がさめ能はおわる。
sen.e: With this noh song, the monk awakes from his dream and the noh play comes to a close.

sen.e: With this noh song, the monk was awakened out of his dream and the noh play comes to a close.
